From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To define the hold character for the current session, use the **terminal hold-character** command in EXEC mode. To return the hold character definition to the default, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: ASCII decimal representation of a character or control sequence (for example, Ctrl-P).

Examples: In the following example, the hold character for the current (local) session is set to Ctrl-P. The show terminal output is included to show the verification of the setting (the value for the hold character is shown in the "Special Characters" listing).
Status: PSI Enabled, Ready, Active, No Exit Banner, Automore On
Special Chars: Escape Hold Stop Start Disconnect Activation
Timeouts: Idle EXEC Idle Session Modem Answer Session Dispatch
History is enabled, history size is 10.
ExtraInfo: You can define a local hold character that temporarily suspends the flow of output on the terminal. When information is scrolling too quickly, you can enter the hold character to pause the screen output, then enter any other character to resume the flow of output.You cannot suspend output on the console terminal. To send the hold character to the host, precede it with the escape character.

RelatedCmds.description: Defines the local hold character used to pause output to the terminal screen.
Displays settings for terminal operating characteristics.
